Functions and Control Flow

  • 17 February 2024
  • JavaScript

My second task using JavaScript involved functions and 'if' statements. The instructions were to: write a function that outputs a sentence, then invoke the function. write a program that combines a first and last name inside a function, then update the function to accept each name as arguments. Add a return statement to this function and use the function to set the value of a variable.

The next part of the task was to make a variable called "temperature". Write some code that tells you to put on a coat if it is below 50 degrees, then extend the program to show the following: if it's less than 50 degrees, wear a coat. If it's less than 30 degrees, wear a coat and a hat. If it's less than 0 degrees, stay inside. Otherwise, just pants and vest is fine. Then add a logical operator to the program

I felt like this task was quite confusing and complicated at first and I was having trouble. However, I looked back at the slides from the session to make more sense of the task, and I started to understand how I would go about doing it. I then looked back at the session recording to make sure I was doing everything right and this further helped me make sense of how the functions and the programs worked.
